website_summaries.verdict: If your kid can't resist the allure of attention-grabbing neon colors, this set of luminous blocks is sure to add some satisfying “pop” to any creation.
pros: With 600 pieces, kids can spend hours putting together unique creations, whether collaborating with friends or working on solo projects
Bright and funky neon colors appeal to all age groups and genders
Suitable as a primary set or an interesting add-on
cons: Some kids may prefer a basic color to create traditional designs
Small pieces might be hazardous to children under 3

customer_reviews.title: The 600 piece set is MINI size....not MIDI size.
customer_reviews.text: Love the “midi-size” version of plus-plus and thought I was purchasing that 600 piece edition. The amazon title description doesn’t say these are the “mini” version anywhere unless you zoom into the box, so I was disappointed in the advertising of these. Five stars for the midi-size, but the mini-size are fairly small and these probably the size of a silver dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: These sit in a bowl on our dining room table ...
customer_reviews.text: These sit in a bowl on our dining room table, and its the first thing everyone sees when they walk in the room, and instantly kids and adults alike start playing with these.
customer_reviews.author: MissCrissy

customer_reviews.title: We get a lot of enjoyment from building toys in general
customer_reviews.text: We get a lot of enjoyment from building toys in general, but I didn't really have high hopes for these simple, identically shaped pieces. I definitely underestimated them. They are truly limitless and inspire building, design and creativity in a way that I think is VERY different from every other building toy on the market. They appeal to a huge age range and the finished builds are really cool, especially once you gain some understanding of how they connect. I would highly recommend this really unique toy.
customer_reviews.author: gxhobo

customer_reviews.title: Is your kid into building/creating? Get these.
customer_reviews.text: Plus Plus were a great find from the last holiday, so much so that they go with us everywhere now. We have a kid (9) who loves Legos, including building his own creations long after the original design has been dismantled. These are colorful, lightweight, easy to use, easy to pack... Literally hours of fun. I love that the company now does sets based on designs, but this simple box of mixed colors is perfect for the kid who's eager to dive right in. We bought more for this year, for the cousins, too, and even the big size for the toddler in the family. A winner!
customer_reviews.author: ibisgirldc

customer_reviews.title: Great for limitless distraction for the kids! Parents, say goodbye to screen time!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my kid because he needed a distraction while we ate out and we didn't want to resort to a phone for screentime over and over again. We got put onto these from a friend and it was amazing how it distracted the kids for the entire meal! It comes in a lot of different colors and can be put assembled in a multitude of ways. My kid is only 2.5 so he just shoves it into his toy van and pickup truck (he only likes industrial, blue-collar type vehicles for some reason). Needless to say it doesn't fit into the toy Porsche that his uncle just got him. Haha.
customer_reviews.author: Everymang

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our 4yo son's birthday, he loved them (and do did we). I think this 300 piece is plenty to start with, we may bump up to the 600 piece set later, once his little brother is older (currently only 1). They are really tiny, so be very cautious where you play with them if you have younger kids. The package they come in is not great for permanent storage, we just used a tupperware container. They fit together easier than legos and have a nice range of colors. We played with them for at least an hour, great for adults and kids. Planning on bringing these on an 8 hour roadtrip and vacation soon!
customer_reviews.author: Glb212

customer_reviews.title: A new take on legos
customer_reviews.text: We bought a set of plus plus blocks after seeing it recommended on Timberdoodle's homeschool curriculum. I'm so happy we did! It made a fantastic Christmas gift for my 5 year old, who could spend hours sitting and building random things with it (usually airplanes). I love the versatility, where your imagination is your only limiting factor in building anything you want. I love watching his little mind work and seeing all the creations he comes up with. Its a refreshing break from his lego sets that keeps his mind busy for hours at a time, which also helps me get other things done around the house or with working from home.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: The kids played with Lego and Mega Blocks before. ...
customer_reviews.text: The kids played with Lego and Mega Blocks before. These plus plus pieces allow you to be a little more creative and allows for thinking outside the box when it comes to the creations.
customer_reviews.author: G.C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those moments of waiting
customer_reviews.text: Since receiving these blocks, my boys have played with them at any moment there has been a "wait". Whether at a restaurant, doctor's office, karate lesson - you name it, they are being played with and I love that they are not using technology but the creative side of their brains. Highly recommend a pouch from the dollar store and have them with you at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Schrade F. Radtke

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy for Building Fine Motor Skills and Big Imaginations.
customer_reviews.text: Found these at a little local toy store and got on Amazon to increase the supply. They're perfect for kids who like to use their imagination but what I really like about them is that for my special needs child who has fine motor issues, these really work his little hands without him knowing it. They are tiny pieces so I don't recommend them for little kids who still put things in their mouths. The small size also makes them easy to take with you on the go. I have a bag of sensory toys and things to keep my kids busy while we're waiting at a restaurant or the doctors office and these go in that bag.
customer_reviews.author: trulyblessedmama

customer_reviews.title: Built well
customer_reviews.text: My children love these. They are made well. However, I’ve purchased these (different brand) in the dollar section at Target and those seemed to be easier for my girls to connect. But, they still love playing with them! (I purchased this 300 pack for $9 before COVID-19. Since then, I’ve seen the price fluctuate between $15-$29. They are definitely not worth that much. So I would shop around before purchasing for that amount).
customer_reviews.author: TB34

customer_reviews.title: Life. Changing.
customer_reviews.text: These are now my go to toy if I need my five and three year olds to stop tearing the house apart for just five GD minutes. My kids are notoriously hard to impress, but these keep them engaged and occupied for as long as I need. Even my dad is enjoying them! Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Lily Saxon

customer_reviews.title: You've got to try these!
customer_reviews.text: Once your child is old enough not to swallow pieces, I urge you to try these things if your child likes legos. They're smaller, a little more versatile, and can easily be taken on long car or plane rides. My son had gotten generally bored with legos and the overall "look" of the things you can build with less than 100,000 blocks. These things were just like his first day with legos. He ignored the Nintendo and the iPad and played for hours, making all sorts of amazing things. And two weeks later he's still playing with them. Just wonderful stuff!
customer_reviews.author: P. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful toy! —just probably not for your child. :)
customer_reviews.text: I think I enjoy this toy more than my son! This is a wonderful creative tool for making any manner of thing. Just like legos but with more malleability. You can create anything from scenic villages to airplanes and boats, and the pieces are high quality. That said, it is more for the careful child or the friend who enjoys puzzling; the small pieces require deft hands and there are no plans for how to build.
customer_reviews.author: Brent D.

customer_reviews.title: Coolest New Toy
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I actually got the recommendation from a friend who swore by them. She was right! My 4 year old loved building with these so much. They kept him entertained. The colors are bright enough and the pieces are big enough not to get lost like all those tiny LEGO pieces do. I’m going to buy more packs. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Katie B.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for elementary age kids, though pricey
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I got an amazing product for my classroom called Snap Art, which was sadly discontinued. I've been looking for a comparable product for 15 years These are sort of close. Easy for the kids to build with, allows for open ended play and experimenting with shapes. Not as versatile as the other manipulative was, but the kids like them. Wish the price point was lower, or the piece count higher. But if you're looking for building toys for elementary age, the kids really enjoy using them!
customer_reviews.author: shae

customer_reviews.title: SO much better than Legos
customer_reviews.text: The possibilities for imaginative play are endless. I love that all of the pieces are exactly the same, save the color. My boys LOVE them. If a piece is lost (they are pretty small), it isn't a deal breaker as it is with Legos because you always have more of the same piece. Legos are great, but when you lose an important and one of a kind piece, there is some disappointment. I give it four stars ONLY because they are REALLY pricey. These are the smaller ones (mini) (5 yo-adult). The bigger size are MIDI (more for 3-5 yo)
customer_reviews.author: M.W.B

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Entertains both my almost-2 and my 4.5 year old (although I don’t recommend it for small children due to choking hazard). A 300 piece box is too small for kids to really make large items, but good enough to test to see if they will like it. It doesn’t make as realistic items as Legos, but I love how the pieces are all the same so it’s not the end of the world if one gets lost.
customer_reviews.author: Psyche

customer_reviews.title: Very small plus plus blocks
customer_reviews.text: While our family loves the regular size plus plus blocks, these were a dud. Theses are very small so be aware of choking hazards. My kids are a bit older, so the biggest gripe I have is that they get lost so easily. I assume that why there's 300 in the package. The kids played with them for a day or so and now they sit on the shelf. They still play with the plus plus regular size blocks daily. We will sticking with them.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: hours of fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kids, ages 5 and 8. We took them on a trip because they are small and light weight and easy to travel with. We visited a family with kids ages 9, 11, 13, and 15. All of the kids sat and played with this set of 600 for hours! They did so many creative things with them and loved them. Their dad ordered a large set after he saw how much the kids loved them. Just be careful though, they are really small. They can easily fall on the floor and if you have a dog or baby they could try to eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie W

customer_reviews.title: Imagination unlimited
customer_reviews.text: Eventhough the pieces are small, our 5 year old grandson spends HOURS building and re-building whatever he imagines. He has difficulty focusing on one thing at a time, and with the PLUS PLUS he sits still and builds and builds!! We are thrilled with this product and we talk about it to as many parents as we can.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Christen

customer_reviews.title: Pieces are very small
customer_reviews.text: I gave these as a gift. The pieces are very small and I would definitely say they are more for ages 5+. It would take great fine motor skills to be able to use these and I definitely would keep them away from any child that is still "mouthing" their toys. I look forward to buying these for my child in the future! They look like a lot of fun and seem comparable to Legos in their versatility.
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Fun Building Toys
customer_reviews.text: These are a go to in my classroom. My students love playing with these. They are a bit challenging to take apart, so it gives them some fine motor practice as they play. There are builds they can follow or make. The other classes in my school began requesting this toy for their classes after they saw how well liked this toy was.
customer_reviews.author: V. N.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: These little jigsaw pieces that kids can use to create whatever they want are AMAZING. My kids play with them for hours. I keep a set in my purse for when we eat out so that they have something to keep them occupied while we wait for food. Buy some. Now. But be advised, they are small. If you have small children who put things in their mouths, you may want to skip these.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great Versatility
customer_reviews.text: My daughter recently discovered these and she loves building all sorts of things. (I'm not sure what most of them are, but she loves it.) The pieces are a bit on the small size, but that wouldn't be the case if she was older (she's 3). This is also a really good price for Plus Plus pieces. We've seen them at stores for quite a bit more than this! I've already purchased additional sets.
customer_reviews.author: Pinkribbon20Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Have them out as Christmas gifts and the kids still love playing with them. I bought bags at target that used for pens and put the plate that goes with these and a box in each bag so the parents could take them to restaurants etc to have something to do with their kids while they wait
customer_reviews.author: Melis

customer_reviews.title: Cool but tiny
customer_reviews.text: These are really cool and the pictures you see of stuff are incredible but these are very tiny pieces. And rather hard to get to stick together in any sort of 3D way you see the pictures. My 5 yr old likes them enough but I’d say stick to legos.
customer_reviews.author: Bob H.

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough good things about Plus Plus
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about Plus Plus. My 10-year old and 5-year old went right to work with these and built lots of 2D and 3D things. We ended up ordering the 1,200 piece set after getting this 600-piece set so they'd have more to build with. This 600-piece set really provided plenty of pieces to make a lot of things, but my two boys want to create more things at the same time so we ordered more.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Give me all the plus plus blocks!
customer_reviews.text: I loved these so much I bought more. The kids LOVE these. They are so creative with them and can be used for many educational activities in the classroom. Great buy for the 2020 classroom. Easy to sanitize just throw in some soapy water, drain, let dry! Great colors and very study.
customer_reviews.author: kevans15

customer_reviews.title: Creations Galore!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a supplement to the gift set that my 6 yr old got for his birthday. He loves these things. They have an app that you can visit that shows a large number of creations or in my son's case, you can use your imagination! From zombies, to fidget spinners to elves and robots. If your child likes to build and create things, these will keep them occupied for hours.
customer_reviews.author: EskmoGrl

customer_reviews.title: Fun building for hours.
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for all ages. This is one of the few building toys that has occupied my kids (aged 2-7) for hours. They love it which in turn makes me love it. The pieces are small so definitely needs to be supervised for smaller children and they'd need help taking it apart, but overall it's great.
customer_reviews.author: BJSB

customer_reviews.title: A hit with my grand daughter
customer_reviews.text: My Grand daughter is nearly 3 and I did not know if she was too young to enjoy these... but wow what a great but small investment these were - she really enjoys playing with them and its great for fine motor skills and exercising the imagination. I'm not totally against all electronic media - but this is a toy that is an encouragement to participation - not just responding to bleeps and buzzes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Phil

customer_reviews.title: Endless fun.
customer_reviews.text: These have been so fun to have around for the kids to play with. We have 4 kids by they love to play with these. Recently I asked my teenager if he thought we could make a chess set out of them. Next thing you know we have one.
customer_reviews.author: Scraphammer

customer_reviews.title: Time killer and portable building toy
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Would like them to provide more building ideas instructions though.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: So simple and the kids all love them
customer_reviews.text: These things are seriously awesome. My eight year old saw some at a local kids' museum and has had her eye on them ever since. Santa brought her this pack and both she and her 6 year-old sister (and Dad) couldn't leave them alone all Christmas day. Then the neighbor kids came over to play and the 6 year-old boy just sat in our kitchen playing with them for well over an hour. There's just something satisfying about building with these and it really seems to draw the kids in.
customer_reviews.author: burgi

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these! They are 6 and 7, we take these for down time at gymnastics and often other kids want to check out what we’re playing with. These are quite small (smaller than the pad of my thumb), so I’ve already found a few random ones that have escaped the box, but they are perfect for little fingers to manipulate. My kids like that then can build flat or 3-D. We plan to get another set.
customer_reviews.author: SMG713

customer_reviews.title: Better than a fidget spinner!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these plus plus blocks. Rather than staring at an endlessly spinning spinner, my kids create something. The blocks are easy for little hands to push together create new designs. My kids have made houses, people, animals...they bring out their imaginations.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Have them out as Christmas gifts and the kids still love playing with them. I bought bags at target that used for pens and put the plate that goes with these and a box in each bag so the parents could take them to restaurants etc to have something to do with their kids while they wait
customer_reviews.author: Melis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small hands
customer_reviews.text: Great gift. Nephew loves them. These are perfect for small hands or anyone that has an issue with those other famous "blocks" that are on the market. Granted the design is different but that is what makes them so great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Clark

customer_reviews.title: My kid loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old was playing at a friend's house with these and asked for his own set. He loves them. If your kid likes Legos try these. Similar, but able to be creative and build in a different way. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: jen...

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: If you have kids and you like to go out to eat, these are a MUST HAVE. We have two packs and my daughters can play for hours with them. The only caveat is they are ONLY allowed to play with them in restaurants so they're always a "new" thing to play with instead of getting bored because they use them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kay

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Get What I Paid For - Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teacher. I bought these to use in my classroom. The box arrived damaged with several pieces out of the package, floating around in the shipping envelope. When I counted the individual pieces, there were only 247 pieces. Not 300 as advertised. I bought these on a recommendation from another teacher. I'm hopeful my students will still love them, but disappointed I didn't get what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: DJ W

customer_reviews.title: Fidget toy great for any age
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my teen daughter. She came across them while we were visiting the Haba toy outlet and they kept her busy the whole time I shopped (shopping for toddlers jist isn't super exciting for teens) She begged me to get her some when we got home so Santa dropped a pack in her stocking ;) She loves to fiddle with them when she's watching TV. This pack isn't big enough to build anything spectacular, but you can create small 3D objects and lots of flat designs.
customer_reviews.author: Danica S.

customer_reviews.title: my 6 year old spends hours with this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6-year-old son who loves Legos. I thought it would be a nice alternative. He really likes them and makes all kinds of things with it. They are very small, so can easily put in a bag and carry them with me if I need some entertainment in a restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: silvia

customer_reviews.title: Great busy toy for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: My teen daughter requested these after the kids got some small packs for Christmas stocking stuffers. They are colorful and keep both my teen and nine year old occupied for hours. You can build quite a bit with the larger packages like this. I may buy another so they can expand their projects.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely the best!!!! My 9 year old loves them, easy to pack up and build wherever and whenever. He makes a ton of little creative things, he says he likes them better than his legos.
customer_reviews.author: E. Becerril

customer_reviews.title: Third graders loved them!
customer_reviews.text: My third graders loved these. I put them out as a S.T.E.M. Station and they had a blast. I overheard them talk about how much fun they were having. They even asked if I could buy some more.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Block

customer_reviews.title: First thing to pack for any trip/ car ride/ dinner out - great for sensory play!
customer_reviews.text: We brings these EVERYWHERE! We love having them around for other kids to play with as well. It’s the best 15-30 min replacement for a screen. Better than legos for older kids b/c it truly is all about imagination and making anything you want. My older son is 11 and Aspergers and he takes a smal pile in his pocket everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Tarabytes

customer_reviews.title: A great toy for all
customer_reviews.text: We keep Plus Plus on our coffee table in a bowl so anyone that's in the room can fiddle with them. They are great little toys that are fun for my 3 year old and Grandpa. We've come up with some pretty awesome creations while having wonderful conversations. It helps keep our hands busy while hanging out so we don't reach for our screens.
customer_reviews.author: Lori VW

customer_reviews.title: So expensive but quality!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing learning toys! My kids love them and will spend hours building stuff. I just wish they were not so expensive. But it’s quality stuff so you are paying for that I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Dosa

customer_reviews.title: Fun.....but....
customer_reviews.text: I like how these connect and how my daughter can use her imagination when she makes things. What I didn't like was how off the number of pieces each colors comes with are no were equal. I would have given it a 5 start if it at least said variety of colors or something on those lines. 600 pieces, 10 colors why not have 60 pieces per color?
customer_reviews.author: MegaMaten

customer_reviews.title: Plus Plus is a great toy with so many possibilities
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy, and a nice change from another popular block toy. I bought a small pack at a local store. They had so much fun building with these that I bought this larger set for a Christmas gift. They don’t take up much space when storing. Their web site has lots of building ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfdog

customer_reviews.title: Mini Plus Plus
customer_reviews.text: This product comes in 2 sizes called MIDI (the larger size) and MINI (smaller version) These are MINI plus plus pieces. The pieces are less than an inch (see my uploaded pictures). Product details do not mention this clearly. The manufacture recommendation is 3yr+ but personally I wouldn't give these to younger children as it could be swallowed or plugged in eyes or nose :( As for creativity we liked it. It's a different option then lego and seems good for fine motor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon's Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kids love these
customer_reviews.text: The kids have loved playing with these. They pretend they are all different things and have a blast. They will play for quite a while with these. And great for their imagination
customer_reviews.author: Chrisandra J.

customer_reviews.title: These things are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Once your child is old enough not to swallow pieces, I urge you to try these things if your child likes legos. They're smaller, a little more versatile, and can easily be taken on long car or plane rides. My son had gotten generally bored with legos and the overall "look" of the things you can build with less than 100,000 blocks. These things were just like his first day with legos. He ignored the Nintendo and the iPad and played for hours, making all sorts of amazing things. And two weeks later he's still playing with them. Just wonderful stuff!
customer_reviews.author: P. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Kinda cool!
customer_reviews.text: Never seen or heard of these before until I bought a small package at a store. Kids really liked them so bought more here. Fun to create with. Even our 15 yo jumps in and builds stuff with his two little sisters. Small children might have a little harder time taking them apart. Small size, beware of choking hazard.
customer_reviews.author: rmh_woody

customer_reviews.title: Get this set,  not the smaller one!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my 6 year old son and he loves them. They’re not an every day toy. But something to pull out at a restaurant or at home for a quick distraction. I contemplated the smaller set, but I’m glad i got this larger one because He’s built some pretty fun things!
customer_reviews.author: Haleym4

customer_reviews.title: My 9 year old grandson really loves these
customer_reviews.text: Keeps him busy for a long time. I keep adding to the amount he has because he likes to keep some of the things he's made instead of taking them apart to make something new. He likes the neon ones best (especially under a black light) but he also mixes in some of the basic ones as well.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah D. MacArthur

customer_reviews.title: These are mini
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt say anywhere in this description that these are mini pieces. I have the regular size ones and wanted to add some pieces since my kids love playing with them. Now it will be a toy for me and my husband so it doesnt get in the mouths of my littles.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy to keep them busy
customer_reviews.text: My kids absolotely LOVE Plus Plus. I first saw them at a store at the mall for much more but found them on Amazon for a more reasonable price. They are a great "busy" toy to travel with or take along to a restaurant, dr's office, etc. Lets them be creative and keeps them from getting bored.
customer_reviews.author: JVA2020

customer_reviews.title: Just as fun as LEGO sets and the kids love them!
customer_reviews.text: My twin 8 year old boys just loved these! Played with them for hours and they are just as durable as LEGO sets if not more !
customer_reviews.author: Paulene M. Eggers

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun, educational and fine motor building
customer_reviews.text: My kindergarteners LOVE these Plus Plus pieces! I use them in my fine motor bins to help my students develop their fine motor skills for handwriting! The children enjoy creating lots of things with these.
customer_reviews.author: RKR

customer_reviews.title: The worst.
customer_reviews.text: I love using my imagination to build with anything I can get my hands on, except these. They do not hold their form and due to shape you will be limited to a very finitecamount of shapes. Nah, nope. Goodwilled em.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Encourages creativity! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This amount if pieces was much better than the little tubes if them! Really great for creativity and building 3D things for my grandson!!! Loved the value and more pieces!!!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Clark

customer_reviews.title: great for 3yr old too
customer_reviews.text: lightweight, pretty colors and not too small for little hands. I bought these to help with finger function and motor skills...great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: nee nee   erb

customer_reviews.title: Fun (and addictive)
customer_reviews.text: These are surprisingly fun! You can make 2D & 3D object with them. I'd recommend getting a clean container to put them in so you can find colors easily We are taking them on our over-seas trip because they are small and can be used on a plane-tray. They are a bit on the expensive side for tiny plastic pieces (I wish they were 100% recycled material), but we all love them
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Boring
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my self thinking that when I'm bored over spring break i can play with them for "hours of fun", that's not what happened I had no idea what to make or how to do it so I ended up making people and using my brothers legos and making a house for them then got bored again in 10min
customer_reviews.author: Miranda c.

customer_reviews.title: Extraordinary
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this product!! I carry it in my car for children (whether mine or not) and it’s always a perfect distraction. Have had relatives order after seeing mine 😁 Gonna order the pastel version next.
customer_reviews.author: PCOWAN26

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet creative
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple bag of toy pieces, but leaves just enough room for the imagination to run. The ability to create many imaginative things reminds me of legos. Pieces are small and are easy to carry with you, but would recommend a sturdier bag for constant transport. Starting with this bag is definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Steidinger

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as the small tube pieces
customer_reviews.text: I bought a small 70-piece tube of these fun pieces a while back. I loved them and decided to buy the larger box. Unfortunately, the larger box's pieces are made of a tougher plastic that's harder on the hands. They're not as flexible, and just not as fun as the pieces from the small tube. They're the same size, but they just move differently. I was disappointed that the materials were not the same.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Henson

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and fun
customer_reviews.text: Both my children (ages 5 & 7) love playing with these! They are so simple but allow for lots of imagine. Sometimes my kids just sort them by color and make up games using as tokens since they are all the same shape/size. Sometimes they build and configure. They are easy to use, small, great to take on the go, and do not hurt nearly as much as legos if stepped on bare foot.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy On The Go Activities
customer_reviews.text: We attended a meeting and another mom had these for her kids to play with. Our kids enjoyed joining in to play with them also. I went a head and bought a few for gifts this year for Christmas. Love the various of color options available.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Levan

customer_reviews.title: New favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun. My kids (ages 3-15) love anything creative and build able. They all enjoy playing with these.
customer_reviews.author: 7beaz

customer_reviews.title: 3 yr old didn't take to it right away
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to put this aside and maybe my granddaughter will appreciate it more later? She like to "build", so I have hopes she'll take to it, but right now, she wasn't interested.
customer_reviews.author: J Woods

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for all ages
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE these. they build all sorts of objects. I even find myself loving to play with them. The pieces are easy to loose but with hundreds of them big deal.. right? perfect for gifting, stocking stuffers etc
customer_reviews.author: SveChe

customer_reviews.title: Plus Plus for all ages
customer_reviews.text: My son loves Plus Plus. He says it is easier than legos to assemble and take apart. He takes these everywhere with him, including travelling and entertains him for hours. Highly recommend for any kid or as a gift !
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Mahan

customer_reviews.title: Love these! I teach Pre-K and the kids in ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I teach Pre-K and the kids in my class love them so much. Each pack of 300 can easily be shared between 4-5 kids, and it is just amazing to watch them build the most creative things.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! These would be a great gift for someone. Small and easy to travel with and entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: kr611

customer_reviews.title: is the variety and creativity that a kid (and adults) can use to make a unique design from the pieces that don't have to end up looking exactly like a picture
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson's 4th birthday. There are very few "toys" he doesn't already own and this was different from all the run of the mill toys out there. What makes this stand out, is the variety and creativity that a kid (and adults) can use to make a unique design from the pieces that don't have to end up looking exactly like a picture, like Legos. Although Legos are great, this seemed to spark my grandson's ideas in his head and make his own designs.
customer_reviews.author: avidreader

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandkids, and they love them! The only negative is that they seem a little expensive for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: S. K.

customer_reviews.title: Kids love these- awesome small
customer_reviews.text: Kids love these- awesome small, quiet toy for church. Have paid for themselves over and over again. If I were to buy them for at home, I'd go with the bigger size (less small pieces to pick up)!
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves creating a variety of things, so she is using these for clever patterns.
customer_reviews.author: AKK

customer_reviews.title: My girls love them!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cool and innovative product with endless variables in regards to creativity! Plus they don’t kill the soles of your feet like Legos if you step on them :)
customer_reviews.author: Bee 🐝 Pantry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We own 2 restaurants that are family friendly - this is the perfect thing for young and older kids to keep them occupied and off their devices...brings out their creativity - adults love them too. I would highly recommend...I have to keep ordering them as the demand increases every day. Reasonably priced too!
customer_reviews.author: Liz Gates

customer_reviews.title: Creative play with hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: Love this toy. My boys play for hours with them building everything from dragons to detachable hang gliders. I recommend getting baseplates too. These work differently than Legos but inspire just as creative play.
customer_reviews.author: RBC

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift for my 7 year old's birthday. They were a huge hit with both my 7 and 4 year old! Encourage creativity, easy to use, and enough blocks to make fun things! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Very Versatile Toy
customer_reviews.text: We love Plus-Plus as much as Legos! They are similar but afford more 3-D building in any direction. My boys make everything from dragons to detachable guys on hangliders.
customer_reviews.author: RBC

customer_reviews.title: Wish they were better colors, but this is a great basic first ...
customer_reviews.text: These toys keep my 5yo busy for hours on end. Wish they were better colors, but this is a great basic first set. I’ve bought a couple other sets with cute colors, and you can find step-by-step instructions to make specific things online or on the PlusPlus app.
customer_reviews.author: dawnica

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love them, I just wish the dog didn't like them as chew treats. We found out about these from a friend. They bring them when we have playdates and all the kids end up circled around building together. They are made in Denmark, which I think is cool.
customer_reviews.author: Junebug

customer_reviews.title: Keeps 4 yr old busy
customer_reviews.text: 4 yr old son loves these. Finished items are a bit "chunky" and you need several kits to build anything substantial which ends up getting expensive.
customer_reviews.author: T. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Adults frequently need to be reminded that these are for ...
customer_reviews.text: Adults frequently need to be reminded that these are for the students to build with! They are a decided hit in my kindergarten classroom. I will be taking them with me to my third grade class because I know that they will be welcomed there as well!
customer_reviews.author: D. Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: My son loves that they are pastel as he creates different things with these colors. I’ve never seen a toy so simple yet so mesmerizing for a 5 year old. A+
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Zacharia

customer_reviews.title: Great for building
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these. They can build a lot of things and do not have to worry about the different sizes. I would say these are better then Legos for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Aguayo

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping a child busy!
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old son got these from a teacher and loved them so much we had to buy more! She never had a student so fascinated by them as my son. Point being if your kid likes legos this might be a fun alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this product! (11, 8, and 5). It gives them room for imaginative play but also has a fee ideas to get them started. This is a quiet toy and small enough to take anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Everyone can be creative!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4, 6, and 8 year old! They spent over a hour TOGETHER playing and making designs with these! Love in our home!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Restaurant entertainment
customer_reviews.text: I took these to an event when my 4 & 7 year old had to sit still. Everyone at the table was amazed how they sat and played with these for almost an hour. I also share them with my 3/4 year old pre school class and they all sit and play. Loved mostly by the boys.
customer_reviews.author: qwertyperty20

customer_reviews.title: the kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: i am an elementary art teacher. I heard about plus plus and thought "Maybe when kids finish their art project early, they can create with plus plus." They love building things and just creating either 2-D or 3-D objects! I would recommend this to anyone that has kids...even teachers. It will keep them busy for hours! I don't feel bad about having the kiddos use these when they have finished their artwork since they can be so creative building with these. I've actually had some kids purchase these since they love them so much!
customer_reviews.author: Erika Sullivan, art teacher

customer_reviews.title: These are such a fun toy. My kids all love them and can ...
customer_reviews.text: These are such a fun toy. My kids all love them and can play with them for hours and hours. My 2 yr old, 4 yr old, 7 yr old, and niece 10 yr old loved them. Great for all ages and nice to take on trips or to keep kids entertained.
customer_reviews.author: arounds

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling with my two sons!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! My two sons (6&9) love playing with these when we travel! They’re small enough that we can toss them in a backpack but big enough for easy pick up. Keeps them both entertained for a good chunk of time creating whatever they want.
customer_reviews.author: Travelingmom

product_meta.title: PLUS PLUS - Open Play Set - 600 Piece - Neon Color Mix, Construction Building Stem Toy, Interlocking Mini Puzzle Blocks for Kids
product_meta.description: Color:Neon| Size:600 Piece| Style:SinglePlus-plus is a whole new class of construction toy! One simple shape contains endless possibilities and hours of fun. Each piece easily connects to the next and lets your imagination Create colorful flat Mosaics or work in 3-D to make more intricate builds. Even curves are possible thanks to the unique design of this deceptively simple shape! A perfect STEM toy to develop fine motor skills, focus and patience - as well as design, imagination and creativity! All plus-plus sets are compatible with each other and this open play set adds more pieces and colors to the collection for more possibilities and fun. This 600 piece set contains 6 different neon colors. Also includes an idea guide booklet for building. Bpa-free and phthalate-free. Designed and made in Denmark.
feature_bullets: BUILDING SET INCLUDES: This open playset includes 600 pieces in a colorful neon mix and an idea guide booklet
SUGGESTED FOR AGES 5-12: Each Plus-Plus piece measures 3/4" x 1/2". Appeals to a broad range of ages! Made from high quality BPA-free and phthalate-free plastic. Made in Denmark.

SIMPLE DESIGN - FUELS CREATIVITY: One shape, endless possibilities! Every brick easily connects to the next. Create colorful flat mosaics or work in 3-D to make more intricate builds. Mix and match any Plus-Plus set to bring more ideas to life!
EDUCATIONAL FUN: Plus-Plus empowers children with free explorative play as they encourage fine motor skills, logic, creativity and imagination all without the use of screens. A great STEM toy.

PERFECT FOR ON-THE-GO: Design and build your creations any way you want, wherever you want! Great for every adventure – car rides, restaurants, a friend’s house, or in your own living room. Stay entertained for hours!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
